intro: Antitaxis fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered antitaxis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
